newsitem.title: FINLAND: ORION, INSTRU MULL MERGER - PAPER.
newsitem.headline: ORION, INSTRU MULL MERGER - PAPER.

text.p: A merger between pharmaceuticals group Orion-yhtyma Oy and health care equipment maker Instrumentarium Oy will be investigated soon, daily Helsingin Sanomat reported on Thursday.
Quoting Juhani Aho, the new chairman of Orion's supervisory board, the paper said the strong cross-ownership between the two companies would be reviewed.

"According to Aho all options are still possible at this stage: the situation can be left unchanged, the cross-ownership can be dismantled so that the firms sell each others' shares or cross-ownership can be deepened possible to a merger," it said.
Orion owns 27 percent of votes in Instrumentarium, which in turn is Orion's biggest single owner with nearly 10 percent of votes, Helsingin Sanomat said.
On Wednesday, Orion appointed Markku Talonen, CEO of Instrumentarium, as its new group president and CEO from June 15.
